title: Ethereum Hits Peak of $1,700 as Investors Add 1.88 Million ETH Since November: Report - U.Today
summary: Ethereum price surged to $1,700, its highest level since the Merge upgrade in September, driven by accumulation of large amounts of ETH by whale and shark addresses. These wallets now hold 47% of the circulating supply, up from 1.88 million ETH since November. Despite Bitcoin maximalists' claims of centralization, the price increase suggests investor confidence in Ethereum's future.

title: Ethereum Whales Buy The Floki Inu Price Dip; What's Next? - CoinGape
summary: Ethereum whales are buying the dip in Floki Inu (FLOKI) despite a 16% price drop in the past 24 hours. According to WhaleStats, the top 100 Ethereum whales have purchased FLOKI in the last 24 hours, making it one of the top 10 most purchased tokens. This suggests that the whales are still bullish on the meme cryptocurrency despite the recent price drop. The token's value has increased by over 120% in the past week, but it has decreased by 43.9% in the past 24 hours. The 24-hour trading volume is also down by 43.9%. Despite this, the circulating supply of FLOKI is approximately 8.9 billion, and the market capitalization is $444 million.

title: The amount of ETH burned will continue to increase as transaction fees are burned - Blockchain.News
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

🚀 Ethereum supply on exchanges decreased by 37% since the Merge network upgrade in September 2022.
💰 The amount of ETH available for buying and selling on exchanges has decreased, indicating a positive trend.
🔒 A significant portion of the Ethereum supply is now being shifted into self-custody, with 14% staked on the Beacon Chain.
🔥 The Shanghai hard fork in March will enable stakeholders and validators to remove their holdings from the Beacon Chain, making more ETH liquid.
🔥 The fee-burning mechanism implemented in the London upgrade has made Ethereum deflationary, burning 2.9 million ETH since August 2021, equivalent to $4.5 billion.

title: Ethereum Price Surges Past $1,700 With Strong Whale Support - CoinGape
summary: Ethereum price surges past $1,700, driven by strong whale support, according to CoinGape. On-chain data provider Santiment notes that shark and whale addresses are holding their ETH supplies strongly, with nearly 47% of the supply held by these cohorts. The Shanghai upgrade in March may lead to Ethereum price volatility as it will introduce withdrawals for 16.5 million ETH staked in the blockchain, potentially changing supply and demand dynamics. Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin shared updates on the Ethereum roadmap, including the focus on sharding and making the blockchain friendly for Layer 2 scaling solutions.
